primarySegments.name: Young Urban Professionals
primarySegments.description: Tech-savvy young professionals living in urban areas who prioritize safety and quick access to emergency services.

problemsNeeds: Need quick and reliable emergency alert system
Desire for peace of mind during commutes and travel
Concerned about personal safety in urban environments
behaviors: Likely to activate the app during commutes
Share app usage with peers for safety tips

primarySegments.name: Elderly Living Alone
primarySegments.description: Older adults who live independently and require a simple emergency alert system for peace of mind.

psychographics: Less tech-savvy but willing to learn for safety
problemsNeeds: Require reassurance for themselves and their families
Concerned about falls and medical emergencies
behaviors: May need assistance setting up the app
Likely to use app in case of health-related emergencies

primarySegments.name: Parents with Young Children
primarySegments.description: Parents who are concerned about the safety of their children and need a reliable emergency alert system.

problemsNeeds: Need to quickly alert contacts in case of family emergencies
Desire for additional safety measures for children
Concerned about child safety in public spaces
behaviors: Teach children how to use the app
Share app with other parents for community safety

excludedSegments.name: Rural Dwellers
excludedSegments.reason: This segment is less likely to have immediate access to emergency services and may not see the value in a mobile app-based solution due to limited connectivity and different emergency response dynamics.
